docs.text: Usage: pyzettel ai [ OPTIONS ] COMMAND [ ARGS ] ... AI commands group Options: --help Show this message and exit. Commands: create Create a new zettel improve Improve an existing zettel using AI scrape Scrape a web page at URL. search Perform semantic search, using 'SEARCH_STRING' tags Usage: pyzettel ai improve [ OPTIONS ] Improve an existing zettel using AI Options: -z, --zettel-id TEXT ID of the zettel [ required ] -l, --language TEXT Language for the generated article -r, --regards TEXT Specify in which respects to improve. Can be given multiple times. --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel ai scrape [ OPTIONS ] URL Scrape a web page at URL. Options: -f, --file TEXT File containing HTML to scrape -g, --tag TEXT Tags for the zettel. Will be added to the auto generated tags. --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel ai search [ OPTIONS ] SEARCH_STRING Perform semantic search, using 'SEARCH_STRING' Options: --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel ai tags [ OPTIONS ] COMMAND [ ARGS ] ... Options: --help Show this message and exit. Commands: find-similar list replace Replace a tag with another tag in all zettels. sync Sync tags in tagsfile with PyZettel ' s tags database Usage: pyzettel ai tags list [ OPTIONS ] Options: -r, --regexp TEXT List tags matching this regex. -s, --show-zettel-title / -S, --no-show-zettel-title show zettels which have the tag. -i, --show-zettel-id / -I, --no-show-zettel-id show IDs of tagged zettels --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel ai tags sync [ OPTIONS ] Sync tags in tagsfile with PyZettel ' s tags database Options: --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel ai tags find-similar [ OPTIONS ] Options: -s, --similarity-cutoff FLOAT Cutoff for similarity --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel ai tags replace [ OPTIONS ] TAG_SPEC Replace a tag with another tag in all zettels. TAG_SPEC is in the format <tag_to_replace>:<tag_replacement> Options: --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel ai create [ OPTIONS ] Create a new zettel Options: -t, --title TEXT Title of the zettel [ required ] -g, --tag TEXT Tags for the zettel -l, --language TEXT Language for the generated article -i, --additional-input TEXT Additional input for AI --help Show this message and exit.

docs.text: PyZettel CLI All pyzettel commands allow to set two generic options: --config-file / -c : Configuration file path. If not provided, use <config-dir>/pyzettel . config-dir depends on the operating system. See the platformdir documentation for details. --log-level / -l : log level Generic options must be passed before the command. The following commands are available: ai AI commands group. Provided by the ai builtin plugin create Create a new zettel init Initialize a new pyzettel configuration list List zettels, using GLOB as a search pattern. paper Create a zettel from a paper DOI rag Retrieval augmented generation commands group. Provided by the rag builtin plugin rm Delete a zettel show Show a zettel on the command line or in an editor. dumphelp Show all CLI commands and options dummy Dummy plugin, used to demonstrate plugin system. Provided by the hello builtin plugin Usage: pyzettel [ OPTIONS ] COMMAND [ ARGS ] ... pyzettel command line interface Options: -c, --config-file TEXT Path to the configuration file -l, --log-level [ NOTSET | DEBUG | INFO | WARNING | ERROR | CRITICAL ] Set logging level --help Show this message and exit. Commands: ai AI commands group create Create a new zettel dummy Dummy plugin, used to demonstrate plugin system dumphelp Show all CLI commands and options init Initialize a new pyzettel configuration list List zettels, using GLOB as a search pattern. paper Create a zettel from a paper DOI rag Retrieval augmented generation commands group rm Delete a zettel show Show a zettel on the command line or in an editor.

docs.text: PyZettel Configuration PyZettel has two main configuration files: pyzettel_plugins : This file is located at <config-dir>/pyzettel_plugins , unless the PYZETTEL_PLUGIN_CONFIG environment variable is set to a different value. config-dir depends on the operating system. See the platformdir documentation](https://platformdirs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#user-config-directory) for details. Note that it is not possible to set this configuration file on the command line, since plugins change the command line parser -- so they must be configured before the command line parser is set up. pyzettel : This file is located at <config-dir>/pyzettel , unless the --config-file option is given on the command line. pyzettel_plugins plugins : pyzettel.plugins.hello : enabled : true options : dummy_option : dummy_value pyzettel.plugins.rag : enabled : true options : chroma_data_dir : /home/hans/.local/share/pyzettel-ask pyzettel.plugins.ai : enabled : true pyzettel.plugins.google_genai : enabled : false options : api_key : GOOGLE-CLOUD-api-key llm_model : gemini-2.0-flash-lite embeddings_model : text-embedding-004 pyzettel.plugins.openai : enabled : true options : api_key : OPENAI-API-key # base_url: https://api.example.org/llm/ embeddings_model : text-embedding-ada-002 llm_model : gpt-3.5-turbo loader_config : log_level : WARNING``` ## `pyzettel` ``` yaml editor : code editor_args : [] id_template : '{{now | hexdate(12)}}' zettelkasten_proj_dir : /home/hans/zettelkasten/ zettelkasten_subdir : docs opencitations_api_key :

docs.text: Usage: pyzettel create [ OPTIONS ] Create a new zettel Options: -t, --title TEXT Title of the zettel [ required ] -g, --tag TEXT Tags for the zettel --help Show this message and exit.
docs.title: Create

docs.text: Usage: pyzettel init [ OPTIONS ] Initialize a new pyzettel configuration Options: -c, --config-file TEXT Path to the configuration file -z, --zettelkasten-dir TEXT Path to the zettelkasten directory -i, --id-template TEXT Template for generating zettel IDs -m, --mkdocs / -M, --no-mkdocs Generate mkdocs configuration -p, --pyproject / -P, --no-pyproject Generate pyproject.toml --help Show this message and exit.
docs.title: Init

docs.text: Usage: pyzettel list [ OPTIONS ] [ GLOB ] List zettels, using GLOB as a search pattern. GLOB defaults to '*' Options: -a, --show-tags display tags for listed zettels. -t, --show-titles show titles of listed zettels. --help Show this message and exit.
docs.title: List

docs.text: Usage: pyzettel paper [ OPTIONS ] Create a zettel from a paper DOI Options: -d, --doi TEXT DOI of paper to retrieve [ required ] -g, --tag TEXT Tags for the zettel. Will be added to the auto generated tags. -r, --generate-references / -no-generate-references, -R Generate references for the publication -c, --generate-citations / -no-generate-citations, -C Generate citations for the publication -b, --generate-bibtex / -no-generate-bibtex, -B Generate bibtex for the publication -a, --add-to-bibtex / -A, --no-add-to-bibtex -w, --download / -W, --no-download --help Show this message and exit.
docs.title: Paper

docs.text: Usage: pyzettel rag [ OPTIONS ] COMMAND [ ARGS ] ... Retrieval augmented generation commands group Options: --help Show this message and exit. Commands: ask Ask your zettelkasten a question. init-db Initialialize database used for RAG. update Ask a question to the zettelkasten Usage: pyzettel rag init-db [ OPTIONS ] Initialialize database used for RAG. Options: --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel rag ask [ OPTIONS ] QUESTION Ask your zettelkasten a question. Options: --llm-model TEXT The model to use for the LLM -z, --show-used-zettels / -Z, --no-show-used-zettels -t, --show-used-tags / -T, --no-show-used-tags -m, --markdown / -M, --no-markdown --help Show this message and exit. Usage: pyzettel rag update [ OPTIONS ] Ask a question to the zettelkasten Options: --llm-model TEXT The model to use for the LLM --help Show this message and exit.
docs.title: Rag

docs.text: Usage: pyzettel rm [ OPTIONS ] ID Delete a zettel Options: -f, --force / -F, --no-force Force deletion without confirmation. --help Show this message and exit.
docs.title: Rm

docs.text: Usage: pyzettel show [ OPTIONS ] ID Show a zettel on the command line or in an editor. Options: -t, --show-title / -T, --no-show-title Show title of zettel. -e, --editor / -cli, --cli Open zettel in editor. -f, --show-filename / -F, --no-show-filename Show filename of zettel. --help Show this message and exit.
